context: I was uncooperative on a group project
letters:
I hope this message finds you well. 

I want to take a moment to sincerely apologize for my lack of cooperation during our recent group project. I realize that my actions may have disrupted our collaboration and affected the team's dynamics. I understand how important effective teamwork is, and I regret not meeting that expectation.

Looking back, I recognize the importance of everyone’s contributions, including yours, and how my uncooperative attitude might have added unnecessary stress to the project. I never intended to undermine the collective effort, and I'm truly sorry for not being a better team player.

I value our working relationship and would like to ensure that we can move forward positively. Please let me know if there’s anything I can do to make amends or if you’d like to discuss this further. 

Thank you for your understanding, and I appreciate your hard work on the project.

Warm regards,  
[Your Name]

Dear [Colleague's Name],

I hope this message finds you well. I am writing to sincerely apologize for my uncooperative behavior during our recent group project. I recognize that my actions may have disrupted the flow of collaboration and affected the overall productivity of the team.

Upon reflection, I understand the importance of working harmoniously with colleagues to achieve our shared goals. I regret that my attitude may have hindered our progress and caused frustration for you and the rest of the team. Please know that it was not my intention to create any challenges, and I deeply value the effort we all put into the project.

Moving forward, I am committed to being a more cooperative and supportive team member. I appreciate your understanding and patience during this time, and I welcome any feedback you may have to help me improve in the future.

Thank you for your professionalism and for being a fantastic colleague. I look forward to working better together on our future projects.

Sincerely,  
[Your Name]
